title: Arsonists drive skip lorry into house before torching it in 'revenge attack'

A skip lorry was rammed into the front of a house before the wrecked vehicle was torched in a suspected revenge attack.

Neighbours on the street in Sheffield, South Yorkshire, watched in horror as the bin wagon did a three point turn before slamming into the property.

The suspects set the wreckage alight before fleeing in a getaway car which was involved in a crash nearby shortly after.

Dramatic footage of the aftermath shows the damaged house which was saved from being burnt down by fire crews.

(Image: Ben Lack/YappApp)

A fleet of ambulances, police cars and fire engines were called to the street just before 7.30pm on Monday.

Witnesses said the skip lorry had reversed into a house – damaging the front of the property – before the vehicle was set on fire.

A spokeswoman for South Yorkshire Police confirmed that detectives are investigating the incident.

She said: “Detectives are currently investigating a suspected arson in Sheffield.

(Image: Ben Lack/YappApp)

“At 7.27pm on Monday, emergency services were called following reports that a bin lorry had been reversed into a property on Shirehall Road, Sheffield, causing damage.

“It is believed that the cab of the lorry was then set on fire. This fire did not spread to the property.

“The occupants of the lorry are believed to have fled the scene in another vehicle.

“This vehicle was then involved in a collision on Beck Road.

“Police believe the incident on Shirehall Road was a targeted act and officers are in the local area carrying out initial enquiries.”

Anyone with information or witnesses can call police on 101 or Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555111.
